snippet.description:
Conspiracy of the Rich is a new book in development by Robert Kiyosaki, the bestselling author of Rich Dad Poor Dad, that has traditionally bucked convention and undoubtedly will yet again with this new work in progress. In this book he challenges conventional wisdom about finance, and teaches readers how to adapt to money's new rules in today's economic turmoil.

This book will be distributed free, online, chapter by chapter, and readers are encouraged to read, ask questions, post opinions and contribute their points of view on the subject. It's a completely collaborative process, and the author will be hosting discussions and inviting commentary throughout.
snippet.title: Conspiracy of the Rich: The 8 New Rules of Money

snippet.description:
Financial Education Video from The Rich Dad Company

Money capital is the lifeblood of every investment. Without capital, there can be no product, no property, no sales, no cash flow. Check out Robert's video about his experiences raising capital for his first entrepreneurial venture.

During this one-of-a-kind, a never-to-be-repeated 3-day event with Robert Kiyosaki and his advisers you will learn:

    * Robert's experiences raising capital
    * Why raising capital is the #1 skill of an entrepreneur
    * How you can develop this skill to benefit your business and real estate investing

Whether your current or future investments involve business or real estate, raising capital is vital to keeping your investments alive and producing cash flow. Robert and his advisors are experts in this important skill who practice what they preach and will share with you their knowledge gleaned from years of real-life entrepreneurship and investment experience.

To increase your financial education, visit www.richdad.com.

#robertkiyosaki #richdadpoordad #financialeducation

how to raise money for a business

snippet.description:
Boost your financial education with Kim and Robert Kiyosaki on their new site for The Rich Dad Company at http://www.richdad.com.

Want to learn more about financial education?

For over 15 years the Rich Dad company has provided financial literacy tools to help people throughout the world get out of the rat race. 

Though the delivery method has moved from books to TV and from the Internet to eBooks, the message has stayed the same.

This dynamic animation was developed for the release of the new, http://www.RichDad.com. The project showcases the fresh, new look with a dynamic visual style that helps display new features available to community members.

By increasing your financial literacy, you can take control of your finances and your future. Check out the site for free information, insights and more.

A Financial Education from Two Dads.
One Rich. One Poor.

The philosophy of Rich Dad was built from a simple lesson learned by Robert Kiyosaki at an early age. He had two dads -- one rich and one poor.

Robert's poor dad, his natural father, was highly educated, the head of the Hawaiian school system, and enjoyed a decent salary. Yet, he constantly complained about having being broke and continually said, "I can't afford it."

Robert's rich dad, his best friend's father, was a high-school dropout building a business. He wasn't wealthy. Yet, he constantly enjoyed the finer things in life and always asked, "How can I afford it?"

The contrast between Robert's two dads taught him a great lesson. Robert realized his poor dad's outlook suppressed his dreams and closed his mind to the possibility of financial freedom. He died penniless and full of regret.

His rich dad's outlook elevated his dreams and opened his mind to life's possibilities. He achieved great wealth, financial freedom, and enjoyed life to the fullest.

Both were good and highly capable men. But only one lived richly.
Financial Literacy is The Key to the Rich Life.

The philosophy of Rich Dad was built from a simple lesson learned by Robert Kiyosaki at an early age. He had two dads -- one rich and one poor.

Throughout his life, Robert's rich dad taught him many valuable, financial lessons. Sometimes Robert listened. Sometimes he had to learn the hard way. But by applying these lessons, Robert became financially-free and retired.

However, Robert wasn't content with retirement. Fueled by the passion to share his financial wisdom with others, Robert created his board game, CASHFLOW®, based on his belief that people learn best through simulation. In 1997, he wrote "Rich Dad Poor Dad" and the rest was history. The book is the best-selling, personal finance book of all time, and it gave Robert the opportunity to teach valuable, financial lessons to a worldwide audience.
snippet.title: Financial Education Video - Robert Kiyosaki's New, Rich Dad Site Helps Boost Financial Literacy

snippet.description: ¿Por qué querrías vivir debajo de tus medios? En este video de "Las Vacas Sagradas," Robert y el equipo de Rich Dad te enseñan la importancia de invertir en activos para levantar tus medios en vez de vivir por debajo de ellos.
snippet.title: Vivir por debajo de tus medios

snippet.description: En 1997, Robert escribió en Padre Rico Padre Pobre que tu casa no es un activo. En ese tiempo, él fue satirizado. Hoy, la gente se está dando cuenta que su casa es un pasivo para ellos y un activo para el banco. En este video, Robert y el equipo de Rich Dad hablan sobre por qué una casa solamente te quita dinero de tu bolsillo.
snippet.title: Tu casa es un activo

snippet.description: Como americanos, nos enseñan a celebrar el valor del trabajo duro. En este video de "Las Vacas Sagradas" Robert y el equipo de Rich Dad redefinen el concepto de trabajar duro -- enseñando la importancia de tener dinero y gente trabajando duro para ti, en lugar de al revés.
snippet.title: Trabajar duro

snippet.description: En este video de "Las Vacas Sagradas," Robert y el equipo de Rich Dad cubren una de las vacas sagradas más malvada: Salir de la deuda. Todos te dicen que cortes tus tarjetas de crédito, pero Robert te enseña por qué la buena deuda es clave en construir riqueza -- y por qué la mala deuda te puede hacer pobre.
snippet.title: Salir de la deuda

snippet.description: En este video, Robert y el equipo de Rich Dad toman una de las vacas sagradas más grandes de todas las demás: Ir a la escuela. Hasta que las escuelas den una educación económica sustantiva, Robert discute, las escuelas solamente proporcionaran una educación incompleta que solo entrena a las personas a ser empleados de los ricos.
snippet.title: Ir a la escuela

snippet.description: Los fondos mutuos son una buena manera de hacer dinero -- si los vendes a otros. En este video, Robert y el equipo de Rich Dad descreditan el mito que invertir a largo plazo en una cartera bien diversificada de acciones, bonos, y los fondos de inversión es la diversificación. Robert enseña que en invertir en activos de papel, no tienes control y tienes el peor descanso en impuestos.
snippet.title: Invertir a largo plazo en una cartera bien diversificada de las acciones

snippet.description: Todos van a la escuela para encontrar trabajo. En este video de "Las Vacas Sagradas," Robert y el equipo de Rich Dad descreditan el mito que encontrar trabajo es bueno — y que hay algo como un buen trabajo. Usando el Cuadrante de CASHFLOW, Robert demuestra por qué los empleados pagan más en impuestos y están más a riesgo de un desastre económico.
snippet.title: Encontrar trabajo

snippet.description: En este video de "Las Vacas Sagradas," Robert y el equipo de Rich Dad preguntan, "¿Por qué ahorrarías dinero cuando el gobierno está imprimiendo más y más?" Robert enseña por qué, desde 1971, el dinero ya no es dinero -- y no vale la pena ahorrarlo. Y como el sistema te roba tu riqueza por medio del dinero.
snippet.title: Ahorrar dinero

snippet.description: In 1997, Robert wrote in Rich Dad Poor Dad that your home is not an asset. At the time, he was lampooned. Today, people are finding out that their house is their liability and the bank's asset. In this video, Robert and the Rich Dad Team discuss why a house only takes money out of your pocket.
snippet.title: Your House is an Asset

snippet.description: As Americans we're taught to celebrate the value of hard work. In this Sacred Cows video, Robert and the Rich Dad Team redefine the concept of working hard—teaching the importance of having money and people work hard for you, instead of the other way around.
snippet.title: Work Hard

snippet.description: In this Sacred Cows video, Robert and the Rich Dad Team ask, "Why would you save money when the government is printing more and more of it?" Robert teaches why, since 1971, money is no longer money—and not worth saving. And how the system steals your wealth through money.
snippet.title: Save Money

snippet.description: Why would you want to live below your means? In this Sacred Cows video, Robert and the Rich Dad Team teach you the importance of raising your means by investing in assets rather than living below them.
snippet.title: Live Below Your Means

snippet.description: In this video, Robert and the Rich Dad Team take on one of the biggest Sacred Cows of them all: Go to School. Until schools give comprehensive financial education, Robert argues, schools will only provide an incomplete education that trains people to be employees of the rich.
snippet.title: Go to School

snippet.description: Mutual funds are a great way to make money—if you sell them to others. In this video, Robert and the Rich Dad Team debunk the myth that investing for the long term in a diversified portfolio of stocks, bonds, and mutual funds is actually diversifying. Robert teaches that by investing in paper assets you have no control and the worst tax breaks.
snippet.title: Get Out of Debt

snippet.description: Everyone goes to school to get a good job. In this Sacred Cows video, Robert and the Rich Dad Team debunk the myth that getting a job is good—and that there's such a thing as a good job. Using the CASHFLOW Quadrant, Robert shows why employees pay the most in taxes and are most at risk for financial disaster.
snippet.title: Get a Job

snippet.description: Newest way to teach your children.

snippet.description:
https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/rich-dad-radio-show/id667485245?mt=8&ign-mpt=uo%3D4

Author of the best-selling personal finance book EVER, Rich Dad Poor Dad, Robert Kiyosaki is going to tell you the truth about money, EVEN IF YOU DON'T LIKE IT!

Hear Robert Kiyosaki's entertaining, compelling and often rebellious point of view on money, entrepreneurship, and more.

In Robert's pull no punches style, he'll lay out the good news and the bad news about money, investments, real estate and the world. Joining Robert will be his business partner and wife, Kim Kiyosaki, their personal advisors and other special guests.

Previous guests include:

· Dave Ramsey
· Ron Paul
· Frank Luntz
· Bert Dohman
· Steven Pressfield
· AND SO MANY MORE!

Listener questions will fire up the hour as Robert tells it like it is. He'll shock you with his uncensored truth while compelling you to think and see money and life in a new way on Rich Dad Radio.
snippet.title: Rich Dad Radio Show

snippet.description:
Rich Dad Poor Dad powered by Clutch Learning. Learning doesn't have to be stodgy or only done in school with stupid books. Let us change your outlook on bettering your finances, click http://ow.ly/uJ84F.

The topics of personal finance, investing, and entrepreneurship are simplified into easily-digested animations, simulations, and videos.
snippet.title: How I !@#$& Learn

snippet.description: Get inside The Rich Dad Company office and view videos on what our top leaders are saying when it comes to investing and starting your own business. As an added bonus, you’ll get the swift motivational kick in the pants from the man who started it all, Robert Kiyosaki.
snippet.title: Rich Dad Insiders: Behind-the-Scenes Insights on Starting a Business & Investing
